byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Jawad Sukhanyar from Kabul, and Taimoor Shah from Kandahar, Afghanistan.

abstract: Thousands of Afghans gather in Kabul to agitate for greater security and end to targeted violence; carry coffins of seven Hazara hostages who were beheaded by their Islamic State captors; accuse Pres Ashraf Ghani of incompetence amid mounting attacks by Taliban and Islamic State fighters.
lead_paragraph: Thousands took the remains of seven ethnic Hazara civilians beheaded by an ISIS-linked group to the presidential palace during the demonstration in Kabul.

headline.main: Protest in Kabul for More Security After Seven Hostages Are Beheaded
headline.print_headline: Afghans Demonstrate for More Security After Seven Hostages Are Beheaded

snippet: Thousands took the remains of seven ethnic Hazara civilians beheaded by an ISIS-linked group to the presidential palace during the demonstration in Kabul.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
